qas.question: When was Mont Blanc first climbed?
When were most of the Alpine fourthousanders climber?
When was the ascent of the Matterhorn?
What did the ascent of the Matterhorn mark?

answers.text: the end of the golden age of alpinism

qas.question: Who was among the first to successfully climb all the major 4,000m peaks?

context: While Mont Blanc was first climbed in <a0_0>1786<a0_0/>, most of the Alpine four-thousanders were climbed during the <a1_0>first half of the 19th century<a1_0/>; the ascent of the Matterhorn in <a2_0>1865<a2_0/> marked <a3_0>the end of the golden age of alpinism<a3_0/>. <a4_0>Karl Blodig<a4_0/> (1859–1956) was among the first to successfully climb all the major 4,000 m peaks. He completed his series of ascents in 1911.
